name: AzureVmss
help: Manage groupings of virtual machines in an Azure Virtual Machine Scale Set (VMSS).

properties.name: Image
properties.help: The name of the operating system image as a URN alias, URN, custom image name or ID, or VHD blob URI. Valid URN format: "Publisher:Offer:Sku:Version".

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of the virtual machine scale set.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: CustomData
properties.help: Custom init script file or text (cloud-init, cloud-config, etc..).

properties.name: DisableOverprovision
properties.help: Overprovision option (see https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/virtual-machine-scale-sets-overview/ for details).

properties.name: EvictionPolicy
properties.help: The eviction policy for virtual machines in a low priority scale set.

properties.name: HealthProbe
properties.help: Probe name from the existing load balancer, mainly used for rolling upgrade.

properties.name: InstanceCount
properties.help: Number of VMs in the scale set.

properties.name: LicenseType
properties.help: Specifies that the Windows image or disk was licensed on-premises. To enable Azure Hybrid Benefit for Windows Server, use 'Windows_Server'. To enable Multitenant Hosting Rights for Windows 10, use 'Windows_Client'. For more information see the Azure Windows VM online docs.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location in which to create VM and related resources. If default location is not configured, will default to the resource group's location.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: PlatformFaultDomainCount
properties.help: Fault Domain count for each placement group in the availability zone.

properties.name: Ppg
properties.help: The name or ID of the proximity placement group the VMSS should be associated with.

properties.name: Priority
properties.help: Priority. Use 'Low' to run short-lived workloads in a cost-effective way.

properties.name: Secrets
properties.help: One or many Key Vault secrets as JSON strings or files via `@{path}` containing `[{ "sourceVault": { "id": "value" }, "vaultCertificates": [{ "certificateUrl": "value", "certificateStore": "cert store name (only on windows)"}] }]`.

properties.name: SinglePlacementGroup
properties.help: Enable replicate using fault domains within the same cluster. Default to 'false' for any zonals, or with 100+ instances See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machine-scale-sets/virtual-machine-scale-sets-placement-groups for details.

properties.name: Tags
properties.help: Space-separated tags in 'key[=value]' format. Use "" to clear existing tags.

properties.name: Validate
properties.help: Generate and validate the ARM template without creating any resources.

properties.name: VmSku
properties.help: Size of VMs in the scale set. Default to "Standard_DS1_v2". See https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/virtual-machines/ for size info.

properties.name: Zones
properties.help: Space-separated list of availability zones into which to provision the resource.

properties.name: AdminPassword
properties.help: Password for the VM if authentication type is 'Password'.

properties.name: AdminUsername
properties.help: Username for the VM.

properties.name: AuthenticationType
properties.help: Type of authentication to use with the VM. Defaults to password for Windows and SSH public key for Linux. "all" enables both ssh and password authentication.

properties.name: GenerateSshKeys
properties.help: Generate SSH public and private key files if missing. The keys will be stored in the ~/.ssh directory.

properties.name: SshDestKeyPath
properties.help: Destination file path on the VM for the SSH key. If the file already exists, the specified key(s) are appended to the file.

properties.name: SshKeyValues
properties.help: Space-separated list of SSH public keys or public key file paths.

properties.name: AssignIdentity
properties.help: Accept system or user assigned identities separated by spaces. Use '[system]' to refer system assigned identity, or a resource id to refer user assigned identity. Check out help for more examples.

properties.name: Role
properties.help: Role name or id the system assigned identity will have.

properties.name: Scope
properties.help: Scope that the system assigned identity can access.

properties.name: PlanName
properties.help: Plan name.

properties.name: PlanProduct
properties.help: Plan product.

properties.name: PlanPromotionCode
properties.help: Plan promotion code.

properties.name: PlanPublisher
properties.help: Plan publisher.

properties.name: AcceleratedNetworking
properties.help: Enable accelerated networking. Unless specified, CLI will enable it based on machine image and size.

properties.name: Asgs
properties.help: Space-separated list of existing application security groups to associate with the VM.

properties.name: DnsServers
properties.help: Space-separated IP addresses of DNS servers, e.g. 10.0.0.5 10.0.0.6.

properties.name: Nsg
properties.help: Name or ID of an existing Network Security Group.

properties.name: PublicIpAddress
properties.help: Name of the public IP address when creating one (default) or referencing an existing one. Can also reference an existing public IP by ID or specify "" for None.

properties.name: PublicIpAddressDnsName
properties.help: Globally unique DNS name for a newly created public IP.

properties.name: PublicIpPerVm
properties.help: Each VM instance will have a public ip. For security, you can use '--nsg' to apply appropriate rules.

properties.name: Subnet
properties.help: The name of the subnet when creating a new VNet or referencing an existing one. Can also reference an existing subnet by ID. If omitted, an appropriate VNet and subnet will be selected automatically, or a new one will be created.

properties.name: SubnetAddressPrefix
properties.help: The subnet IP address prefix to use when creating a new VNet in CIDR format.

properties.name: VmDomainName
properties.help: Domain name of VM instances, once configured, the FQDN is 'vm<vm-index>.<vm-domain-name>.<..rest..>'.

properties.name: VnetAddressPrefix
properties.help: The IP address prefix to use when creating a new VNet in CIDR format.

properties.name: VnetName
properties.help: Name of the virtual network when creating a new one or referencing an existing one.

properties.name: AppGateway
properties.help: Name to use when creating a new application gateway (default) or referencing an existing one. Can also reference an existing application gateway by ID or specify "" for none.

properties.name: AppGatewayCapacity
properties.help: The number of instances to use when creating a new application gateway.

properties.name: AppGatewaySku
properties.help: SKU when creating a new application gateway.

properties.name: AppGatewaySubnetAddressPrefix
properties.help: The subnet IP address prefix to use when creating a new application gateway in CIDR format.

properties.name: BackendPoolName
properties.help: Name to use for the backend pool when creating a new load balancer or application gateway.

properties.name: BackendPort
properties.help: When creating a new load balancer, backend port to open with NAT rules (Defaults to 22 on Linux and 3389 on Windows). When creating an application gateway, the backend port to use for the backend HTTP settings.

properties.name: Lb
properties.help: Name to use when creating a new load balancer (default) or referencing an existing one. Can also reference an existing load balancer by ID or specify "" for none.

properties.name: LbNatPoolName
properties.help: Name to use for the NAT pool when creating a new load balancer.

properties.name: LbSku
properties.help: Sku of the Load Balancer to create. Default to 'Standard' when single placement group is turned off; otherwise, default to 'Basic'.

properties.name: DataDiskCaching
properties.help: Storage caching type for data disk(s), including 'None', 'ReadOnly', 'ReadWrite', etc. Use a singular value to apply on all disks, or use '<lun>=<vaule1> <lun>=<value2>' to configure individual disk.

properties.name: DataDiskSizesGb
properties.help: Space-separated empty managed data disk sizes in GB to create.

properties.name: EphemeralOsDisk
properties.help: Allows you to create an OS disk directly on the host node, providing local disk performance and faster VM/VMSS reimage time.

properties.name: OsDiskCaching
properties.help: Storage caching type for the VM OS disk. Default: ReadWrite.

properties.name: OsDiskName
properties.help: The name of the new VM OS disk.

properties.name: OsType
properties.help: Type of OS installed on a custom VHD. Do not use when specifying an URN or URN alias.

properties.name: StorageContainerName
properties.help: Only applicable when used with `--use-unmanaged-disk`. Name of the storage container for the VM OS disk. Default: vhds.

properties.name: StorageSku
properties.help: The SKU of the storage account with which to persist VM. Use a singular sku that would be applied across all disks, or specify individual disks. Usage: [--storage-sku SKU | --storage-sku ID=SKU ID=SKU ID=SKU...], where each ID is "os" or a 0-indexed lun. Allowed values: Standard_LRS, Premium_LRS, StandardSSD_LRS, UltraSSD_LRS.

properties.name: UltraSsdEnabled
properties.help: Enables or disables the capability to have 1 or more managed data disks with UltraSSD_LRS storage account.

properties.name: UseUnmanagedDisk
properties.help: Do not use managed disk to persist VM.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Scale set name. You can configure the default using `az configure --defaults vmss=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: InstanceIds
properties.help: Space-separated list of IDs (ex: 1 2 3 ...) or * for all instances. If not provided, the action will be applied on the scaleset itself.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: Subscription
properties.help: Name or ID of subscription. You can configure the default subscription using `az account set -s NAME_OR_ID`.

properties.name: ProtectFromScaleIn
properties.help: Protect the VM instance from scale-in operations.

properties.name: ProtectFromScaleSetActions
properties.help: Protect the VM instance from scale set actions (including scale-in).

properties.name: Add
properties.help: Add an object to a list of objects by specifying a path and key value pairs.  Example: --add property.listProperty <key=value, string or JSON string>.

properties.name: ForceString
properties.help: When using 'set' or 'add', preserve string literals instead of attempting to convert to JSON.

properties.name: Remove
properties.help: Remove a property or an element from a list.  Example: --remove property.list <indexToRemove> OR --remove propertyToRemove.

properties.name: Set
properties.help: Update an object by specifying a property path and value to set.  Example: --set property1.property2=<value>.

properties.name: Created
properties.help: Wait until created with 'provisioningState' at 'Succeeded'.

properties.name: Custom
properties.help: Wait until the condition satisfies a custom JMESPath query. E.g. provisioningState!='InProgress', instanceView.statuses[?code=='PowerState/running'].

properties.name: Deleted
properties.help: Wait until deleted.

properties.name: Exists
properties.help: Wait until the resource exists.

properties.name: Interval
properties.help: Polling interval in seconds.

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: Maximum wait in seconds.

properties.name: Updated
properties.help: Wait until updated with provisioningState at 'Succeeded'.

properties.name: IsWindowsOs
properties.help: For Windows VMs.

properties.name: VmssName
properties.help: Scale set name.

properties.name: NoAutoUpgrade
properties.help: If set, the extension service will not automatically pick or upgrade to the latest minor version, even if the extension is redeployed.

properties.name: ProtectedSettings
properties.help: Json string or a file path containing private configurations such as storage account keys, etc.

properties.name: Version
properties.help: Version of the diagnostics extension. Will use the latest if not specfied.

properties.name: Caching
properties.help: Disk caching policy.

properties.name: Disk
properties.help: Existing disk name or ID to attach or detach from VM instances.

properties.name: Lun
properties.help: 0-based logical unit number (LUN). Max value depends on the Virtual Machine instance size.

properties.name: SizeGb
properties.help: Size in GB. Max size: 4095 GB (certain preview disks can be larger).

properties.help: Underlying storage SKU.

properties.name: ExtensionInstanceName
properties.help: Name of the vm's instance of the extension. Default: name of the extension.

properties.name: ForceUpdate
properties.help: Force to update even if the extension configuration has not changed.

properties.name: NoAutoUpgrade
properties.help: If set, the extension service will not automatically pick or upgrade to the latest minor version, even if the extension is redeployed.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: ProtectedSettings
properties.help: Protected settings in JSON format for sensitive information like credentials. A JSON file path is also accepted.

properties.name: ProvisionAfterExtensions
properties.help: Space-separated list of extension names after which this extension should be provisioned. These extensions must already be set on the vm.

properties.name: Settings
properties.help: Extension settings in JSON format. A JSON file path is also accepted.

properties.name: Version
properties.help: The version of the extension.
